values:
well, i'll be calling people while drunk tonight, so if you want me to hit you up, lemme know. if i have not your digits, toss them over to jack_flash16@yahoo.com. 



it should be fun.
yeah, you wish you had this...
inner peace is hard to attain when you're surrounded by jack-asses.

...when you're younger uncle is playing the irish jig music on a saxophone right in front of you. 

i have finally received a copy of the teachings of buddha...god bless kern county library. i intend to read it all by the end of the week.

i meditated again for the first time in more than a week, and i realized how much good it did me. 

but in the end, what else can i say but...

i miss her.

my ramen bowl awaits...

'cept for this:

SunHitsTheSky777: man. i'm gonna be a meathead thursday. I'm nervous
godhatesjack: my uncle's busting out on the saxophone
godhatesjack: he's playin the irish jig
godhatesjack: hey, don't sweat it
SunHitsTheSky777: why is your uncle playing an irish jig on a saxaphone?
godhatesjack: why not
godhatesjack: 1. he's younger than me
godhatesjack: 2. he's practicing for his band class
godhatesjack: 3. and he got tired of me making him play the mission impossible theme
godhatesjack: so what's the meathead wage?
SunHitsTheSky777: man, i hope you don't get offended by this, cos it's true,  but only mexican americans have uncles and aunts younger than the nephews and nieces
godhatesjack: i dunno, i mean it's not that uncommon for a grandparents to squirt out another kid
SunHitsTheSky777: I get 8.50 an hour. Makes you wanna pick up some barbells, huh?
godhatesjack: but i'll admit, the mexican americans have a knack for it
godhatesjack: not bad
godhatesjack: but i'm sure you'll be earning it
SunHitsTheSky777: in blood
godhatesjack: whenever i imagine meat head movers i just get this picture of beefcake guys in short shorts with shaved heads, no neck, and a white t-shirt with their first name on it 
SunHitsTheSky777: yeah, you pretty much got it there. (minus the shirts)
godhatesjack: that's too bad, the shirts would make it complete

it looks like i'm in bakersfield another week. oh well, i'm not complaining. it's not santa maria, but it still is blazing hot. a small price to pay. 

that's really all.

i have a headache induced by the shiny floors in k-mart.

it's funny how a few days ago i felt like the king. and it's funny how it took a few days for all the bells and whistles and glamour to fade, and now i'm back with thinking about how flawed my life is. 

so the plan is set. in november i leave for colorado. by then ch4 will be frozen while dr. sean is doing the national guard deal. with that, i really have nothing left here in california. 

looks like i'm returning on sunday/monday. returning to what, really...

at least ch4 still has some practices and a show or two to kick out before we go. that's what i'm looking foward to.

and for the record:

i hate bakersfield.

well, as of now i am broadcasting from soledad, which normally i despise but now i love it because it's not bakersfield, which i shall be returning to tomorrow because we're helping my grandma move stuff to her new house.

september 11, bakersfield

first day we got there we drove around looking for family and such. we stayed at dr. sean's aunt's house. great woman. she had a dog named angie. i must admit it induced a smile out of me the entire time i was there. rickey fed her a corn-nut and the dog got sick the next day. 

september 12, jerry's pizza, basement...earth.

third band up, ch4. we did rock in my opinion, and got it on video as proof. it was probably our most responsive crowd, we had cheering and moshing (kinda) and whoah's on the right songs. now i'm convinced the music crowd in santa maria is useless. it's nice to know it's possible for people to appreciate what we're doing.

and that night i decided this is what i want to do for the rest of my life. after we finished our set a couple freshmen looking kids came up to me and one of them told me jerry only was his hero and i said he was mine too and the kid almost hit the ceiling. he and his friend followed me around for the rest of the night telling me how great i was and asked for my autograph. i was pretty damned suprised, and so i gave gave them one even though i thought they were joking. the misfits kid had this huge smile on his face and he said he was gonna tape it onto his bass, then we just talked about the misfits. i seriously just wanted to hug that kid. i don't think i've ever felt that good before about anything i've ever done.

the past few days have been an experience for me. definately life changing. i'd really like to see that video. the band before us, wiggum (wiggumrocks.com) were great guys and stuck around to hear us play. i think they said they were from orange county. 


anyway it looks like i'm gonna be in bakersfield for another week or so. :( ah well. i need sleep now, my neck really hurts. 

get some!

...and i don't know what to do.

lots of suprises lately. i really don't feel like talking about them here, though.

on a lighter note:
i have a job interview tomorrow and it would be nice to work again. the other day i bought a book on yoga and i started that and trying to meditate again. i'm astounded at my progress this time around. lately i've been taking everything extremely well and i'm very calm and composed for the most part. i think this is what's keeping me from cracking and going crazy.

What Is Your Battle Cry?

Zang! Who is that, striding through the tarmac! It is Bob_bob_mcknob, hands clutching a reflective halberd! And with a gutteral scream, his voice cometh:

"I'm seriously going to hump you to the moon and back!!"

i think i've had a personality shift. i feel like my old self again...













...that's not a good thing.
...i wonder why i got up in the morning.

i finally saw my misfits on saturday in ventura. it was one of the best things that ever happened to me, jamaica being the best. 

the first three bands sucked, but they were the local bands so i guess that's a given.

d.i. was okay, but really didn't do that much for me. 

the dickies were totally nuts. the singer was amazing. he danced and did aerobics and had a penis puppet.

and balzac...jesus christ balzac totally kicked ass. it was the first time i had ever heard them and they were so damn good. 

the damned were great, but they played a bit too long. the singer totally looked like bruce campell. 

then finally...

THE MISFITS! that was just too good for words. just believe me it was awesome. jerry only, dez (who bears a striking resemblance to turok the dinosaur hunter), and marky ramone (the worst ramone ever). i was kinda disappointed they didn't play longer. after the show i got my ticket signed by jerry, turok, and all the guys from balzac. jerry only is the nicest guy on the planet, i shook his hand and talked to him and took a picture with him. my ears are still ringing and i'm sore from showing the stupid people what for, but it was well worth it.

If I were a month I would be: december, the gloomy weather and overall happy people are a nice clash of contrast

If I were a day of the week I would be: friday

If I were a time of day I would be: about noon-ish

If I were a planet I would be: saturn

If I were a sea animal I would be: an otter, they don't take nothin from nobody...plus they're damn cute when they swim on their backs when they're eating clams

If I were a direction I would be: up

If I were a piece of furniture I would be: anything, as long as it wasn't a couch in the wrong house...if you know what i mean. d'oh!actually i'd probably be a beanbag.

If I were a sin I would be: lust

If I were a historical figure I would be: karate gandhi, you know...gandhi's brother...who kicked people's asses.

If I were a liquid I would be: some kinda smoothie i suppose

If I were a tree I would be: one that doesn't take crap from kids

If I were a flower/plant I would be: venus fly trap

If I were a kind of weather I would be: rainy and moderate temperature

If I were a musical instrument I would be: a bass, obviously

If I were an animal I would be: mexican staring frog

If I were a color I would be: the color that makes you shut the hell up

If I were a vegetable I would be: a pear

If I were a sound I would be: a scream into a sob

If I were an element I would be: turbonium

If I were a car I would be: moderately priced

If I were a song I would be: some kinda love by the misfits

If I were a movie I would be directed by: tim burton

If I were a book I would be written by: hp lovecraft

If I were a food I would be: a small plate of cheese and crackers

If I were a place I would be: with my loved one

If I were a material I would be: a lock of hair 

If I were a taste I would be: bittersweet

If I were a scent I would be: fresh baked cake

If I were a word I would be: eccentric

If I were an object I would be: an oscar mayer weenie whistle

If I were a body part I would be: a ring finger

If I were a facial expression I would be: a flat one

If I were a cartoon character I would be: sometimes i think i am one

If I were a shape I would be a: out of

If I were a number I would be: 9

times change. people change. i've changed. 

i have a job. and it's treating me fine. my band is just taking off. me and jamaica have been together for over a year. 

that's really all i have to say.

this day of monday i spent playing guitar, getting out of my house,...and best of all...


cleaning up a giant congealed blood spill.

hey, i got a candy bar out of it.

last nite was mock rock. and in an odd turn of events, we came as close as we could to winning. our name was actually on that check then scribbled out for the winning band's name. 

however, we put on one hell of a show. we all dressed up like zombies and yours truly had the jerry only look going with black lipstick and michael was holding a copy of the necronomicon. when the curtains rose, we had this girl joy scream and run out on stage as we shambled after her, then she pretended to trip we were almost upon her then we saw our instruments and started playing. we played last and rocked that house.

pretty much all the acts that nite were really awesome. i saw a lot of people i hadn't seen in a long time. dustin stone is down from long beach and asked me for my number cause he thinking about starting a band during the time he's here.

man, the closest you'll ever get to another band is the time when you play a competition with them. the commercials and ch4 will soon be playing a show together so keep an ear to the ground. those guys are damn good.

everything's been going pretty good. soon i'll start working and be even happier. and i think today rickey is buying our tickets to what will be the day i descend to a higher level of existance. 

and i love jamaica. that show was for her.

i guess you know when you're a good band when other bands try to rip off your songs. 

last nite my band played at some coffee house in morro bay, the playing area was about as big as a bathroom. it wasn't so bad, we drew in people that were just walking by. i'm guessing that was the most people that place had seen in a while. some guy even insisted on video taping us. 

i guess the kicker of the night was this. the other band we played with actually ripped off one of our songs to the note. they took the whole song and put new lyrics to this. i guess to most people this probably isn't a big suprise, but in the music principle of things it's a travesty. and the sad thing was we had just played that song during our set. even dr. sean was pissed (as he clearly expressed with middle fingers and a loud explitive), as were the rest of us. i still don't know exactly what to think of the whole ordeal. some people never change, i suppose.
i now have a job. take that all who doubted me.

thank you oh rollie fingers...

<html>http://www.grandstandinc.com/pages/14114.htm</html>

so...gimme some input.

we totally rocked. and i don't think anyone can say otherwise. i think even the anti-fan could say anything bad if he tried.

i'm so damn sore. me and rickey spent half the show in the air. 

and WE WERE IN THE NEWS! ha!

and i can't wait till they put out the video of the battle of the bands. 

seriously, it was our best show ever. i was so damn happy.

and i feel like if i stop i'll drop dead.




and people still continue to frustrate me...

i'm losing my touch with things. or everything. or just the important things. i can't remember which. 

it's days like this i'm afraid to stay in my house. i like the idea of leaving my room once in a while.
i don't know why i do the things i do anymore. a lot of things upset me, but i guess that's what kind of person i am, as unfortunate as that is. i wish i could trade myself in for a new me.

ah good times. this day has been going by slow. which wasn't really a bad thing. practice will be soon. i finished evangelion. damn good. i love jamaica. i think that's about it.

i can't think of anything to write. 

"sometimes you just wake up wishing you never had at all"

it's actually about maybe 9 or 9:30. usually i'd still be in bed but today i found good reason for getting up early. 

today i'm getting a haircut. man, that's gonna feel crazy. meh, either way i'm just gonna grow it back out again. just thought i'd see how it felt.

job searching like crazy. MMMM bitch!

last night i played silent hill 2 and that game scares the pants off me. when i was playing i didn't see this demon thing until i stopped right by it, and i pretty much jumped. man, i thought i was better than that.

i feel like taking old clothes, cutting them up and sewing them back together. alas i am out of safety pins. it's very therapuetic (did i spell that right? pff, who cares) to destroy something and put it back together in a manner that suits you. besides, it's like buying new clothes, you got one more thing to wear. this doesn't make any sense. 

i'm frustrated right now. i've considered going to the dollar store to see if they have bottles of cough syrup, for my own deviant purposes. at least i completed my crappy mid-term for captain stump. 

jamaica's locked down and even though it's been a few days it's like a small eternity and then some. what fun.i listened to the velvet underground for the first time today and they were awesome. shitty shitty bang bang.

i can't think of anything to write. i just want to ramble on nonsense to show how frustrated i am...

you very well know for a fact this is how it's going to be you can't lose fate it'll always there like the dog you never wanted always nipping at your heel sure you think if you can speed up a bit you might be able to lose it but you can turn around and sure enough there it is what can you really do but sit there and accept what has happened you realize you probably reached a dead end in life but is there a chance to still turn around sure why not even in a dead end you can always spin a few degrees and you have a new way to go will it be better than the last who knows for sure but it's sure as hell a lot better as your last route look where that took you but then again isn't that what life is you'll always be eternally chosing paths like a lost child but never know if the one your on is the right one you can look back and see what you've left behind and all you'll see is the blood and tears your path has been paved with like all the rest of us but there will only be one set of footprints and that is your own you alone will walk the path and occasionally another will walk with you but not very long before their paths lead them elsewhere in life and you're left back to yourself but then again if you can't walk with yourself who can you walk with but regardless one might choose to follow one another if they belive they mean that much to them it may eventually all be in strife but for that moment in your life you'll have the satisfaction of knowing for that spot in time somebody was with you...

i love you jamaica...it's going to be okay. no matter how bad things get i'll never leave your side.

yeah that was all stupid and stuff. but yeah.

i remember one day i was walking around school when i met my old friend greg, who has a leg for an arm and an arm for a leg. i heard he was kicked off the track team because of the fact he had to cartwheel to get around the track and that bothered everybody. anyhoo, he was wearing one of those porkpie hats, which really wasn't as much of a hat as it was an actual pie. apparently he has to bake a new one every morning. like i was saying, i conversed with greg and we remisced about the good old days, when we used to hang out with great white chubby and peruvian paul. well, peruvian paul wasn't his real name, his real name was panama hank, we just called him peruvian paul cause he was from minnesota. as for great white chubby, well let me tell you, there was no greater skinny black man we had ever known. greg was always changing his name, so it was about this time he was no longer greg but george. george always had something to say, and it wasn't what he said it was always the way he said it, like the last time when he was talking about spontaneous human combustion and he set a kid on fire just to show what it would look like, needless to say i bought a pair of asbestos boxers the next day...for safe keeping you know. all of a sudden george was grant and grant said "hey remember when we had to eat chubby?" it all came back to me, we were all on a camping trip, it was me, peruvian paul, great white chubby, and gary (grant was gary back in those days). apparently we had eaten chubby because we were out of marshmallows and so we drew straws to see who would be dinner. it was either eat chubby or spam. as you could tell we weren't fond of spam. poor chubby, a few years after that i heard chubby's parent's finally realized he was dead after they did their taxes and it turns out they had saved millions on food and wondered what the cause of this was. i hear a realization like that is like running backwards naked through a cornfield. i did that once on a bet, and i ran into an angry farmer who i hear is still in therapy for catching a glimpse of me...a few months later they make the movie signs and i still haven't gotten credit for it, let alone a royalty check.  i guess what i'm really trying to say is...what's with the onion?

man i have so many faults i should live by LA and change my name to san andreas. ah hell i got nothin'. 

settingyouonfire: can I say something to as a friend
godhatesjack: sure go ahead
settingyouonfire: to you*
settingyouonfire: because I care about you two

...that's all i'll show. 
yesterday i didn't go to sleep until my step mom poked her head in my room and asked me why i was still up at 5:30. i just shrugged and just kinda hopped in bed for the sake of whatever. i think i'll try for staying up all the way again tonight. the day after is always so nice.

 "pepperoniandgreenpeppersmushroomsoliveschives!

i just promoted myself to a hero and gerhalt is now a wolf baron. and you have no idea what the hell i'm talking about.

i should be doing an outline for polysci...god i hate that class. who knew a guy with one hand could be such a dick.


"i shall decide to shoot you, and you won't stop me because you know you want this as much as i do, maybe more."

"babies cry because they aren't old enough to tell everyone off"

that's it for now. i hate you. :)

today wasn't so bad. i cleaned up the room and basically stayed out of my parents' range of criticism. people have been suprising me lately. i don't know if that has any real meaning but nevertheless it's been interesting. i don't really feel like typing much else.

yeah thanks a lot. you all got your wish. i had a fucked up valentine's day, and yes, i spent all by my goddamn self.

i hate my parents. they had a field day tearing me down in my already bummed mood. i hate them so much. i'm not part of this family, to them it's just them two and the boy. they could care less if i was in the other room almost on the verge of tears. as long as i don't bother them...

my dad was almost going to help me see jamaica tomorrow, but he decided he hates me and i'm just a failure and that's why he had some other kid to take my damn place.

i've pushed away all my friends and i've got nothing left. why was i put into existance if i was just going to be eternally bent over to take it from anything and everything? it doesn't make any sense, i never hurt anybody. i just want to be happy...is that just too selfish for me?
